task_summary: Pick the grid clamp and place it precisely onto the grid board area with correct yaw and gentle press, then release and retreat. [attached_image:1]

task_long_description.overview: A 6‑DoF manipulator with a parallel gripper operates over a wooden grid board to handle a small dark clamp object placed on the table surface, approaching, grasping, transferring, and placing it with alignment to the board grid. [attached_image:1] The scene shows the arm moving from a right‑side home near the SARA base toward clustered clamps, then toward the center board region for a careful placement. [attached_image:1] The behavior emphasizes accurate approach, low force contact, and a brief press to ensure seating before opening the gripper and retreating. [attached_image:1]
preconditions: Robot is powered, homed, and gripper calibrated with clearance above the work surface. [attached_image:1]
Grid clamp is visible on the table and reachable without collisions. [attached_image:1]
Grid board placement area is unobstructed and within the manipulator workspace. [attached_image:1]
stepwise_plan: Search and detect the grid clamp, then move above it and compute a top grasp. [attached_image:1]
Open gripper, execute grasp, verify stability, and lift to a safe height. [attached_image:1]
Search and detect the grid board region, align with tight tolerance, and descend until light contact. [attached_image:1]
Place on the board with set yaw, apply gentle press, open gripper, and retreat. [attached_image:1]
success_criteria: Clamp is released stably on the grid board within tight in‑plane alignment. [attached_image:1]
No slip or tip occurs during release and immediate retreat. [attached_image:1]
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, rescan the area with a grid pattern and reattempt approach. [attached_image:1]
If grasp is unstable, reopen, recompute top grasp, and retry after slight re‑approach. [attached_image:1]
If contact force is too high or misaligned, retreat slightly, realign, and lower again within tolerance. [attached_image:1]
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the clamp is placed on the board and the tool has retreated to a safe offset. [attached_image:1]

frame_3.now_evidence: Gripper is centered above the target cluster, suggesting computed grasp pose readiness. [attached_image:1]
frame_3.predicts_next: A downward motion into grasp or lift is expected following this poised alignment. [attached_image:1]
frame_3.uncertainty_reduction: Pose alignment reduces ambiguity about grasp strategy and next action. [attached_image:1]

objects: SARA base box and workspace fixtures [attached_image:1]

node_specs.description: Checks if the clamp is already held to skip the pick branch. [attached_image:1]
Scan the workspace using a grid pattern to localize the clamp. [attached_image:1]
Confirm precise detection of the clamp for grasp planning. [attached_image:1]
Move to a safe pregrasp height over the clamp. [attached_image:1]
Prepare finger aperture for top grasp. [attached_image:1]
Compute a standard top grasp pose for the clamp. [attached_image:1]
Execute the grasp using the computed standard top strategy. [attached_image:1]
Verify that the grasp wrench is stable before lifting. [attached_image:1]
Lift to a transit height after grasp. [attached_image:1]
Orient the tool yaw to match board placement orientation. [attached_image:1]
Scan for the placement board region. [attached_image:1]
Confirm the board target pose for precise approach. [attached_image:1]
Move to a safe preplace height above the board. [attached_image:1]
Approach and align tightly to the board grid. [attached_image:1]
Descend slowly until light contact is sensed. [attached_image:1]
Place the clamp on the board with gentle press and correct yaw. [attached_image:1]
Back away to a safe standoff. [attached_image:1]
Brief dwell to ensure stability after placement. [attached_image:1]

failure_modes: Perception fails to localize the clamp due to occlusion or clutter. [attached_image:1]
Top grasp collides with neighboring parts in the cluster. [attached_image:1]
Misalignment during placement causes edge contact or rocking. [attached_image:1]
recovery_strategy: Rescan with grid pattern and slightly adjust viewpoint by re‑approach above target. [attached_image:1]
Reopen, recompute grasp, and reattempt after a minor lateral move. [attached_image:1]
Retreat, realign with tighter tolerance, and lower again with low force threshold. [attached_image:1]
assumptions: The intended placement is onto the grid board surface rather than into a specific slot since no clear slot is visible. [attached_image:1]
Multiple similar dark clamps are present; the behavior selects one instance to pick and place. [attached_image:1]
Yaw alignment of 90° matches the board orientation inferred from scene geometry. [attached_image:1]

expected_success_criteria: Clamp remains stable on the board after release and retreat without sliding. [attached_image:1]
